summary: Build a multi-page website for "Captain Pizza" with separate pages (Home, Menu, About, Contact, Signup/Login, Cart/Checkout), including add-to-cart + checkout where users choose WhatsApp (send full order + customer details to owner) or Zomato (redirect), plus AI-generated item images and an updated logo.
architectural_notes: Set Captain Pizza Zomato order URL to https://www.zomato.com/ncr/captain-pizza-1-karawal-nagar-new-delhi/order (keep configurable in one place).

Checkout should offer a single selection between WhatsApp vs Zomato fulfillment; WhatsApp path generates a prefilled message containing full checkout details for the owner’s WhatsApp number (to be provided).
Update Contact/Location details: Address = "Oppo, Rajmandir Hyper Market, F-11, Main Road, Block D, Dayalpur, Biharipur, Delhi, 110090"; Hours = "Open · Closes 10 pm"; Phone = "7725895804".

WhatsApp checkout message should be formatted with a clear "*ORDER DETAILS:*" header and include customer address + full cart/menu items with names/variants/add-ons/qty/unit price/line totals and a "*BILL SUMMARY:*" section (Subtotal, Delivery, Total), using a similar structure to the provided example (not a verbatim copy).
Site should be multi-page (not a single long scrolling page), with distinct routes/pages for Home, Menu, About, Contact, Signup/Login, and Cart/Checkout.
Remove/replace the "Order" / "Order Now" tab/section; primary purchase flow should be Add-to-Cart -> Cart/Checkout (still offering WhatsApp vs Zomato at checkout).
Menu items should display images generated/selected via AI based on the item name/category (e.g., pizza, burger, shakes).
Add a cart UI indicator (badge/popup) showing item count whenever items are added and persistently in the header/cart entry point.
Add a Signup/Login page/flow that captures user details (name, email, phone, address) and sends them to the owner (delivery mechanism TBD).
known_issues: Deployed site opens to a white screen on multiple devices/browsers; likely frontend crash during load. User requests rebuilding the frontend.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing website for the pizza store named "Captain Pizza" with core pages/sections: Home (hero + CTAs), Menu (items + prices), About, Contact (address/phone/hours), and an "Order" section that prominently offers WhatsApp ordering and Zomato ordering.

Implement a coherent visual theme for the "Captain Pizza" site (distinct colors, typography, spacing, and component style) and apply it consistently across all pages/sections. Avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

Add a WhatsApp ordering flow: provide an order form that collects customer name, phone number, delivery/pickup preference, address (if delivery), and free-text order details; generate a WhatsApp "send message" deep link that pre-fills the message with the captured details and opens WhatsApp (or WhatsApp Web) to send the order to the store’s WhatsApp number.
Add a prominent "Order on Zomato" CTA that redirects users to the Captain Pizza Zomato listing to place an order. Make the Zomato URL configurable in one place.
Add static generated brand assets and use them in the UI by placing them under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and referencing them directly from the frontend (no backend image routing).

Update the configured Zomato listing URL in `frontend/src/config/siteConfig.ts` to exactly `https://www.zomato.com/ncr/captain-pizza-1-karawal-nagar-new-delhi/order` and ensure all existing Zomato CTAs (e.g., hero button and checkout option) open this URL in a new tab.

Implement an add-to-cart flow on the Menu section: each menu item must support selecting a quantity and adding/removing items from a cart, and the cart must show item name, unit price, quantity, and line total.

Replace the current dedicated WhatsApp/Zomato ordering cards in `frontend/src/components/sections/OrderSection.tsx` with a single cart + checkout UI (no separate WhatsApp or Zomato sections). At checkout, the user must choose an order method: WhatsApp or Zomato.

For the WhatsApp checkout path, collect the required checkout details (customer name, phone number, delivery/pickup, delivery address when delivery) and send a WhatsApp deep link message to the owner that includes: customer details + delivery address (if applicable) + full cart contents with quantities and prices + any additional order notes. Reuse/extend the existing WhatsApp utility (`frontend/src/utils/whatsapp.ts`) and remove reliance on the current free-text-only `orderDetails` flow.

For the Zomato checkout path, clicking 'Continue to Zomato' must redirect the user to `siteConfig.zomatoUrl` (new tab) and clearly communicate that the rest of the ordering and payment will be completed on Zomato.

Make the owner WhatsApp number used for WhatsApp checkout configurable via `siteConfig.whatsappNumber`, and add a clear UI hint in checkout if the configured number is still a placeholder so the site owner can replace it with the real number.

Update the site contact configuration in `frontend/src/config/siteConfig.ts` to use the provided business details: address `Oppo, Rajmandir Hyper Market, F-11, Main Road, Block D, Dayalpur, Biharipur, Delhi, 110090`, hours `Open · Closes 10 pm`, and phone `7725895804`. Ensure these updated values appear anywhere contact details are rendered (e.g., Contact section and footer).

Update the configured store WhatsApp number in `frontend/src/config/siteConfig.ts` so WhatsApp checkout sends the order to the owner number `7725895804` (stored as E.164 digits without `+`, i.e., `917725895804`).

Replace the hardcoded menu items in `frontend/src/components/sections/MenuSection.tsx` with the full menu provided by the user, organized under clear categories/headers: COMBO-1 (including the listed item description and price), COMBO-2 (all listed variants and prices), 'SUNDAY' Bole to (ANY MEDIUM PIZZA ₹499.00), COMBO-3, COMBO-4, BURGERS & WRAP (all items + prices), SHAKES & MOKETAIL (all items + prices), PIZZA (all items + prices including the listed sub-groups like CHOICE OF JAIN CRUSTS, SPECIAL OFFER CLASSIC VEG. CATEGORY, DELUXE VEG., SUPREME VEG.), PASTA, GARLIC BREAD STUFF, FRENCH FRIES (with size/variant pricing as provided), and VEG. DOUBLES. Ensure each listed item is add-to-cart compatible and the displayed names/prices match the provided text.

Change the WhatsApp checkout message format in `frontend/src/utils/whatsapp.ts` so the owner receives an order message similar in structure to the user-provided example, including: a clear `*ORDER DETAILS:*` section, the customer's name and phone, the order type (delivery/pickup), the customer's delivery address when delivery, a fully itemized cart list showing quantity, item name, unit price, and line total, and a `*BILL SUMMARY:*` block that includes Subtotal and Total. If order type is delivery, include a Delivery charge line (make the delivery fee configurable via `siteConfig`, and apply it only when delivery). End the message with a confirmation line in English that is similar in intent to: asking to confirm and provide delivery details, without copying the example text verbatim.

Convert the current single long scrolling page into a multi-page site with these routes/pages: Home, Menu, About, Contact, Signup/Login, and Cart/Checkout. Each page must render only its own content (do not render all sections on every page).

Update the header and footer navigation to use the new page routes instead of scroll-to-section behavior. Remove the existing 'Order' nav/tab and remove/replace all 'Order Now' CTAs in the header/hero with an 'Add to Cart / View Cart' focused flow (e.g., 'View Cart' or 'Go to Checkout').

Add a persistent cart indicator in the header that shows the current cart item count as a badge. When a user adds an item to the cart from the Menu page, show immediate feedback (badge update and a small popup/toast or similar) that confirms the item was added.

Move the existing cart + checkout UI (currently in the 'Checkout/Order' section) into the dedicated Cart/Checkout page and ensure the checkout method selection remains: WhatsApp (opens WhatsApp with the full structured order message) or Zomato (opens `siteConfig.zomatoUrl` in a new tab and explains ordering/payment completes on Zomato).

Add a Signup/Login page that includes a user details form collecting: name, email, phone number, and address. On submit, forward these details to the website owner by opening WhatsApp with a pre-filled message sent to `siteConfig.whatsappNumber` containing the captured signup details.

Add AI-generated product/category images for menu items and display an image thumbnail on each menu item card. Images must be chosen automatically based on item name/category keywords (e.g., pizza, burger, wrap, shake, pasta, fries, garlic bread, combo). Store images as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and reference them directly from the frontend (no backend image routing).

Replace the current site logo with the user-uploaded Captain Pizza logo image across the site (header, footer, and any other logo usage). Ensure the resulting logo asset is clean, centered, and readable at small sizes.

Fix the white-screen issue by restoring a working React render tree: replace the current `App` placeholder (which returns `null`) with the real application shell that mounts TanStack Router using the existing `routeTree` so that pages (Home/Menu/About/Contact/Signup/Checkout) render correctly.
Add a minimal, user-friendly runtime fallback so that if the frontend throws during initial render, users see an English error message with a refresh instruction instead of a blank screen.

Replace the placeholder `App` component (currently returning `null`) with a real application shell that mounts TanStack Router using the existing `routeTree` so the site loads and routes render (Home, Menu, About, Contact, Signup, Checkout). This must be implemented without editing `frontend/src/main.tsx` (immutable) by making `frontend/src/App.tsx` render the router.

Add a minimal, user-friendly runtime fallback so that if the frontend throws during initial render (including router initialization), users see an English error message with a refresh instruction instead of a blank screen.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a marketing website for the pizza store "Captain Pizza".
Add an order option that lets users place orders by sharing details via WhatsApp.
Add an order option that redirects users to the Captain Pizza Zomato listing to place an order.
Add an add-to-cart + checkout flow; at checkout users choose WhatsApp (send order + customer/contact/address details to owner) or Zomato (redirect to Zomato). Avoid separate WhatsApp/Zomato sections.
Convert the site from a single long page into separate pages (Home, Menu, About, Contact, Signup/Login, Cart/Checkout) with navigation.
Add AI-generated product images for menu items (e.g., pizza, burger) based on item names and display them on the Menu.
Add a Signup/Login option that collects user details (name, email, phone, address) and forwards them to the website owner.
Replace/remove the "Order"/"Order Now" tab and CTAs and use an Add-to-Cart focused flow instead (cart + checkout).
Show a cart popup/badge with item count when items are added, and keep the cart count visible in the UI.
Update the site logo to the user-provided Captain Pizza logo image.
